title: ISic000579. I.Sicily inscription 000579
body:
Facsimile Images

1DOMITIACHIMEN
2NAAAEMILIO
3ARISTOMENIETSUIS
4HM
5HNS

Apparatus criticus

  • CIL

English translation

Domitia Chimenna for Aulus Aemilius Aristomenus and his children. This monument does not pass to the heir.

commentary

Korhonen makes a convincing case that the text is originally from Termini, not an importation from Rome; he also notes the unusual name, attested also in CIL 10.7394, with suffix similar to other Greek examples, and perhaps a Sikel onomastic example (noting that linguistic interference is rare in the Termini Latin inscriptions).

bibliography

  • Gualtherus 1624 no. 89 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002388
  • Gualtherus 1624 [1625] no. 249 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001931
  • 10.7400 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • 06.1700 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000269
  • B2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
  • Korhonen 2001 98-102 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001425
